instructions: Compile the firmware manually as described from https://os.ratrig.com/docs/manual-firmware-compilation
When compilation is succesfully finished, you can download the file ~/klipper/out/klipper.uf2
Push and hold the BOOTSEL button and plug your Pico into the USB port of your Raspberry Pi or other computer.
If you are using the desktop, it will mount as a Mass Storage Device called RPI-RP2.
just drop the file klipper.uf2 on it and wait till it is rebooted
If you are using the console, follow the intructions bellow:
Locate the rp2040 device usb address using lsusb | grep -i raspberry
You will get an output similar to: Bus 001 Device 007: ID 2e8a:0003 Raspberry Pi RP2 Boot
Notice the ID address, you will need it later
Flash the toolboard with command bellow:
It will return an output similar to below:
Found rp2040 device on USB bus 1 address 7
